title: Error Analysis of Kernel/GP Methods for Nonlinear and Parametric PDEs. (arXiv:2305.04962v1 [math.NA])
abstract: We introduce a priori Sobolev-space error estimates for the solution of nonlinear, and possibly parametric, PDEs using Gaussian process and kernel based methods. The primary assumptions are: (1) a continuous embedding of the reproducing kernel Hilbert space of the kernel into a Sobolev space of sufficient regularity; and (2) the stability of the differential operator and the solution map of the PDE between corresponding Sobolev spaces. The proof is articulated around Sobolev norm error estimates for kernel interpolants and relies on the minimizing norm property of the solution. The error estimates demonstrate dimension-benign convergence rates if the solution space of the PDE is smooth enough. We illustrate these points with applications to high-dimensional nonlinear elliptic PDEs and parametric PDEs. Although some recent machine learning methods have been presented as breaking the curse of dimensionality in solving high-dimensional PDEs, our analysis suggests a more nuanced picture: t

Title: Error Analysis of Kernel/GP Methods for Nonlinear and Parametric PDEs. (arXiv:2305.04962v1 [math.NA])
Abstract: We introduce a priori Sobolev-space error estimates for the solution of nonlinear, and possibly parametric, PDEs using Gaussian process and kernel based methods. The primary assumptions are: (1) a continuous embedding of the reproducing kernel Hilbert space of the kernel into a Sobolev space of sufficient regularity; and (2) the stability of the differential operator and the solution map of the PDE between corresponding Sobolev spaces. The proof is articulated around Sobolev norm error estimates for kernel interpolants and relies on the minimizing norm property of the solution. The error estimates demonstrate dimension-benign convergence rates if the solution space of the PDE is smooth enough. We illustrate these points with applications to high-dimensional nonlinear elliptic PDEs and parametric PDEs. Although some recent machine learning methods have been presented as breaking the curse of dimensionality in solving high-dimensional PDEs, our analysis suggests a more nuanced picture: t
translated_title: 关于非线性和参数PDE的核/GP方法误差分析
translated_abstract: 我们引入了使用高斯过程和基于核的方法解决非线性和可能是参数PDE的先验Sobolev空间误差估计。主要的假设是：（1）核重现空间在足够正则的Sobolev空间中的连续嵌入；（2）微分算子和PDE的解映射在相应的Sobolev空间之间稳定。这些误差估计展示了在PDE的解空间充分光滑的情况下具有维度友好的收敛速率。
tldr: 本文介绍了使用核/GP方法估计非线性和参数PDE通过Sobolev空间误差，并指出当PDE的解空间充分光滑时，具有维度友好的收敛速率。
en_tdlr: This article introduces a priori Sobolev-space error estimates for the solution of nonlinear, and possibly parametric, PDEs using Gaussian process and kernel based methods, demonstrating dimension-benign convergence rates in smooth PDE solution spaces.
